ygData.subject: Too much EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Sylly, That s a lot of EQ.  I suppose I have fallen asleep at the keyboard once or twice myself.  One time in particular I remember being tired and taking the
ygData.messageBody:
Sylly,

That's a lot of EQ. I suppose I have fallen asleep at the keyboard once or
twice myself. One time in particular I remember being tired and taking the
boat ride from Freeport to Butcherblock. I fell asleep at the keyboard and
awoke several hours later to

you are hungry
you are thristy
you are out of food
you are out of drink

scrolled up and the buffer has been full of miscellaneous chatter and
LOADING, PLEASE WAIT... I had probably taken the round trip about 12 times.
It's a good thing that you can't die of starvation in this game.

I can't say as I've ever lost my corpse, as I REALLY hate logging and
leaving it lying around. I retrieve before camping whenever possible. I
did leave it in the Savant's room in Lower Guk the other night when 1/3 of
the zone was LinkDead at any given time. It got kinda ugly in there that
night.

Crier

> <blushes>
>
> Well, if you MUST know....
>
> There have been times when I wake up in the morning in r/l and get to the
> PC, log in, etc. etc. and there I am nekkid at me bind spot. Hmmm, wonder
> where I died last knight??? I vaguely remember something about
> South Karana.
> Guess I'll head that way and check it out. Zone to HH: you have
> no corpses
> in the zone. Zone to EK: you have no corpses in the zone. Zone to NK: you
> have no corpses in the zone. Zone to SK: you cannot summon that
> corpse from
> here. Ahh! Time to mem Lyssia! =)
>
> Or I have come back to the screen and the text buffer is spammed with:
> you are hungry
> you are thristy
> you are out of food
> you are out of drink
>
> Look at my health bars and sta is at zero. And I am either
> blocking a zone,
> or nose against some far zone wall, or standing idly in the Gfay
> wiz spires
> (I fall alseep zoning or traveling and either die, hit a wall,
> stay at zone
> or my wiz fiends have been known to tele me to Gfay and leave me in the
> relative safety there ;p)
>
> But even when I am awake, dungeons and me simply get me all mixed
> up. I get
> lost really easy. My group gets real sick of leading me and out all the
> time. Run to the zone? You got to be kidding! Of course, it
> dont help when
> the route you take in is different from the route to run out and you never
> practice the run out (which I do now - when they take me
> somewhere new) "ok,
> jump down here.." Jump here? How the hell am I supposed to get out???
> (Sol-a, Perma, and Lguk all have spots like that.)
>
> And the new places we got to now - you got to have an evac person or be
> prepared to fite your way in and back out. We spent a long knight in Lguk
> Frenzied room. At 3am as we were heading out, we decided to check the Exe
> room but someone lost invis in the middle of the jail. Soon we had more
> than 10-15 froogies on us (full party of 6). We paniced. Someone
> said Zone
> and we bolted. Now the number of froggies doubled. I died real fast. I
> think 3 of the party made the zone. We should have stood our ground and
> fought. We had an enchanter who 10 of the mezzed. All we had to do was
> kill them one by one. But we paniced and ran and that did half of us in.
>
> So, to answer your question, MOST of the time I know pretty much
> where I am
> but if I am ever in doubt I just do /w sylly all and it tells me zactly
> which zone I am in and then I am fine =)
>
> Sylly Songsynger
> Bard of the 36th Song
> <Spirit of the Moon>
> somewhere on Innoruuk
>
> p.s. one time after helping someone get their corpse outta
> Runnyeye, we are
> Selos back from Gorge to HH ramp and go thru that canyon by the shops. I
> see this corpse laying there and think: hmm, wonder who the fool was that
> died here? So, I target and guess what? "a Sylly corpse0" Hehe, it's ME!!!
> So, I go over and loot it - WOW so that's where my spare drum went!!!
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: JasonF [mailto:JasonF@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 17, 1999 1:04 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] dual weild
>
>
> From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>
>
> Sylly,
>
> After reading your recent posts about being lost all of the time,
> I have to
> ask about your signature.
>
> > Sylly Songsynger
> > Bard of the 36th Song
> > <Spirit of the Moon>
> > somewhere on Innoruuk
>
> Do you say "somewhere on Innoruuk" because you don't know *where*
> exactly??
>
> Crier
>
